name: Alexander Hamilton!
desc: Alexander's name is sung in this recurring melody. Reportedly Lin-Manuel heard the melody in the sound of a door closing. In 'The Reynolds Pamphlet', Jefferson Madison and Burr sing this melody in minor to introduce Hamilton with an ominous air.

name: Whoah, whoah whoah oh oh
desc: This melody, first heard in the foreground of 'My Shot', recurs in lots of places later in the musical as a background melody played as a solo piano line.

name: How does a...?
desc: The opening question of the musical, which Lin has described as 'a run-on question that we puzzle at but never really answer'. This template opens up 5 songs and asks much of Alexander.

name: Aaron Burr's Theme
desc: This chord progression underscores all of Aaron Burr's major songs (excluding 'The Room Where It Happens') and recurs in key moments that involve Burr, including his entrance in Right Hand Man.

name: Talk Less, Smile More
desc: Burr's first words of advice to Hamilton are repeated multiple times in the musical, and even echoed back to Burr at a key turning point in Act 2. If you've seen the show, there's also an accompanying bit of choreography in which Burr seems to gesture towards invisible floating words in front of him.

name: Angelica's Theme
desc: Angelica's theme is an arpegiating sequence that often plays behind Angelica's key moments. Interestingly, it's the same chord progression as My Shot and will often accompany the My Shot Anthem. The arpegiating sequence, first introduced in Satisfied, moves up and down a minor pentatonic scale, suggesting Angelica's mind moving back and forth between her wants and her responsibilities.

name: I'm Only 19 But My Mind Is Older
My name is Philip, I am a poet
